definition[0]: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants
example[0]: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
example[1]: pandas and other endangered species (=ones that may soon no longer exist)
example[2]: The park is a sanctuary for 41 endangered species.
example[3]: Elephants are a protected species in Indonesia.
example[4]: The area contains many rare species of plants.
example[5]: Here you will see most of the common species of African wildlife.
example[6]: About a hundred species are becoming extinct every day.
example[7]: A new species of spider has been discovered in a field in Cambridgeshire.
example[8]: Desert broom is a species native to Arizona.
example[9]: You can see many different bird species on the canal.
example[10]: This species is found only in the Southern Hemisphere.
example[11]: Many rainforest species cannot live anywhere else.
example[12]: The species grows wild in Europe.
